SEARCH

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Inventory extends Object implements Serializable
An inventory is a list of items that the player has. To add items, use the addItem method, and insert an item object. Items remain in the inventory until they are deleted, even if their quantity is zero.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Creates a new inventory. An inventory is a list of items that the player has.

      To use this inventory, create a unique item object and insert it into the inventory using the addItem method. This will create the item with the initial quantity of 0. Change the quantity of the item using the updateItemQuantity method.

      You can use the inventory methods to change the various values of the item. Items remain in the inventory until they are deleted, even if their quantity is zero.

      To use an item, use the useItem method. This method will decrease the quantity of the item by 1.

  • Method Details

    • addNewItem

      public void addNewItem(Item i)
      Adds an item to the inventory. If an item with the same name already exists, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      i - the item to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an item with the same name already exists in the inventory

    • deleteItem

      public void deleteItem(String itemName)
      Completely deletes an item from the inventory by its name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item does not exist in the inventory

    • getItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getItems()
      Retrieves all items in the inventory.
      Returns:
      a list of all items in the inventory

    • getItemType

      public String getItemType(String itemName)
      Finds an item by its name and returns its type (food or gift).
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to search for
      Returns:
      the type of the item if found, or null if the item is not found

    • getItemQuantity

      public int getItemQuantity(String itemName)
      Finds an item by its name and returns its quantity.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to search for
      Returns:
      the quantity of the item if found, or -1 if the item is not found

    • updateItemQuantity

      public void updateItemQuantity(String itemName, int value)
      Updates the quantity of an item by adding the specified value.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to update
      value - the value to add to the current quantity. Can be positive or negative.

    • getItemScoreIncrease

      public int getItemScoreIncrease(String itemName)
      Finds an item by its name and returns its score increase.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to search for
      Returns:
      the score increase of the item if found, or -1 if the item is not found

    • hasItem

      public boolean hasItem(String itemName)
      Checks if the inventory has an item.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to search for
      Returns:
      true if the inventory has the item, false otherwise

    • useItem

      public Item useItem(String itemName)
      Uses an item from the inventory by decreasing its quantity by 1.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to use
      Returns:
      the item if its quantity is greater than 0, or null if the item's quantity is 0
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item does not exist in the inventory
